summary: An email from a Victim Witness Coordinator at the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, forwarding a report of a strange phone call. The caller claims he and his mother were kidnapped multiple times by a group that included Jeffrey Epstein, who he recognized from news coverage. The caller alleges torture and the killing of his attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified by the anonymous caller as one of the men in a group that allegedly ordered the kidnapping and torture of the caller and his mother, and watched the torture.

events.title: Report of Kidnapping and Torture
events.description: An anonymous caller reports to the US Attorney's Office that he and his mother were kidnapped multiple times, tortured, and that his attorney was killed by a group that included Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Strange Phone Call to US Attorney's Office
events.description: A Victim Witness Coordinator at the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York receives and forwards a report of a strange phone call alleging serious crimes connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza New York New York
keyFacts: An anonymous individual contacted the US Attorney's Office claiming he and his mother were victims of multiple kidnappings orchestrated by a group that included Jeffrey Epstein.
The caller stated he only recognized Epstein as one of his alleged kidnappers/torturers after seeing Epstein's picture in the paper following his arrest.
The caller alleges that during these kidnappings, he and his mother were tortured, and his attorney was killed by this group.
The caller claims to have previously reported these kidnappings to the Special Agent in Orange County, California.
The email shows the Victim Witness Coordinator forwarding this unverified tip to FBI colleagues for follow-up.
